content: Was left unimpressed with the interior of the 579, Kenworth's T680 felt better interior wise.
author: Jackhole

content: Well my 403,000 mile 2015 579 just lost the EGR valve I believe. Had a big cough today. And than a bit later told me shut engine down immediately. I never did until I parked tonight. Diagnostics is showing code 1209 (EGR GAS PRESSURE). But it is running good. Had a hell of a time on US 259 in Smitheville, OK are on that Ozark path of a road. I call the boss tomorrow.
author: TripleSix

content: Does not seem very good in many ways. When they get 3 years old don't be surprised if the door key locks stop working. More will be noted as I find out.
author: X1Heavy

content: They didn't mention the best feature of all on this truck. Why not talk about the AI camera, and the points system, and all the micromanage that will occur?
author: DarthVader

content: This 389 walkaround is incredible! The attention to detail on the chrome package is amazing. Peterbilt really knows how to make a statement truck.
author: TruckShowEnthusiast

content: Just finished my 579 UltraLoft sleeper tour. The space is unreal - feels like a small apartment. Perfect for team drivers or anyone doing long haul.
author: SleepCabReviews

content: Comparing the 579 to the Freightliner Cascadia. Honestly the Peterbilt wins on build quality but loses on tech features. It's a trade-off depending on what you value.
author: TruckComparison

content: DEF system delete tutorial for Peterbilt 579. WARNING: This is for off-road use only. Don't do this if you're running legal. Just showing what's possible.
author: DieselMods

content: My honest review after 2 years with the 389. The good: power, looks, resale value. The bad: parts cost, dealer network in rural areas, some electrical gremlins.
author: HonestTruckerReview

content: Peterbilt 567 dump truck in action! This thing is a beast in the quarry. The set-back axle configuration is perfect for tight job sites.
author: HeavyEquipmentChannel

content: Why I switched from Kenworth to Peterbilt after 15 years. The 389 just has that presence on the road that the W900 doesn't quite match anymore.
author: OldTimerTrucker

content: Peterbilt 579EV first drive! The instant torque is insane. Quiet cab, smooth acceleration. The future is here folks, whether we like it or not.
author: ElectricTruckNews

content: Common problems with the Paccar MX-13 engine in Peterbilts. Turbo failures, injector issues, and EGR problems. Here's what to watch for.
author: DieselMechanic101

content: Installing a custom sound system in my 389. The factory speakers are garbage but the cab acoustics are actually pretty good once you upgrade.
author: TruckAudioMods

content: Peterbilt factory tour in Denton, Texas. Amazing to see how these trucks are built. The quality control is impressive - every truck is hand-inspected.
author: FactoryTourVlogs

content: My 579 just hit 500k miles with the original Cummins X15. Regular maintenance is the key. Oil changes every 25k, filters on schedule. Still runs like new.
author: HighMileageClub

content: Peterbilt vs Volvo VNL comparison. The Volvo has better fuel economy but the Peterbilt has that American truck feel that European designs just can't match.
author: TruckBrandWars

content: How to adjust the air ride on your Peterbilt 579. Factory settings are too stiff for most drivers. Here's my preferred setup for long haul comfort.
author: TruckTuning

content: The new 2025 Peterbilt 579 interior walkthrough. They finally updated the dash! New screens, better controls, and improved ergonomics. About time!
author: NewTruckReviews

content: Peterbilt 389 Pride and Class vs Standard - is the upgrade worth $15,000? Let me show you exactly what you get for the money.
author: TruckValueGuide

content: Why owner operators love the 389 but fleet managers prefer the 579. It comes down to fuel economy vs driver satisfaction. Here's the breakdown.
author: TruckingBusinessChannel

content: Peterbilt dealer tried to charge me $3000 for a repair I did myself for $200. Always get a second opinion and learn basic maintenance!
author: DIYTrucker

content: Night driving in my 579 with the LED light package. Visibility is incredible. Best upgrade I ever made for safety.
author: NightHaulDriver

content: Peterbilt 520 garbage truck review. These things take a beating every day and keep on going. Perfect for municipal work.

content: The real cost of owning a Peterbilt 389 for one year. Fuel, maintenance, insurance, payments - I tracked everything. Here are the numbers.
